<li id="cite_note-Kurushkin-177"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Kurushkin_177-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Kurushkin_177-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFKurushkin2020">Kurushkin, Mikhail (2020). <a class="external text" href="https://www.researchgate.net/publication/342152661" rel="nofollow">"Helium's placement in the Periodic Table from a crystal structure viewpoint"</a>. <i>IUCrJ</i>. <b>7</b> (4): 577–578. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<span class="cs1-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1107%2FS2052252520007769" rel="nofollow">10.1107/S2052252520007769</a></span>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/PMC_(identifier)" title="PMC (identifier)">PMC</a> <span class="cs1-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a class="external text" href="//www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC7340260" rel="nofollow">7340260</a></span>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/PMID_(identifier)" title="PMID (identifier)">PMID</a> <a class="external text" href="//pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/32695406" rel="nofollow">32695406</a>. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20211019202250/https://www.researchgate.net/publication/342152661_Helium%27s_placement_in_the_Periodic_Table_from_a_crystal_structure_viewpoint" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 19 October 2021<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">19 June</span> 2020</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=IUCrJ&amp;rft.atitle=Helium%27s+placement+in+the+Periodic+Table+from+a+crystal+structure+viewpoint&amp;rft.volume=7&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.pages=577-578&amp;rft.date=2020&amp;rft_id=%2F%2Fwww.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov%2Fpmc%2Farticles%2FPMC7340260%23id-name%3DPMC&amp;rft_id=info%3Apmid%2F32695406&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1107%2FS2052252520007769&amp;rft.aulast=Kurushkin&amp;rft.aufirst=Mikhail&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.researchgate.net%2Fpublication%2F342152661&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3APeriodic+table"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-PTSS-178"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-PTSS_178-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-PTSS_178-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-PTSS_178-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-PTSS_178-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-PTSS_178-4"><sup><i><b>e</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-PTSS_178-5"><sup><i><b>f</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-PTSS_178-6"><sup><i><b>g</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-PTSS_178-7"><sup><i><b>h</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-PTSS_178-8"><sup><i><b>i</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Scerri, pp. 392−401</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-179"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-179">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFGrochala2017">Grochala, Wojciech (1 November 2017). <a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1007%2Fs10698-017-9302-7" rel="nofollow">"On the position of helium and neon in the Periodic Table of Elements"</a>. <i>Foundations of Chemistry</i>. <b>20</b> (2018): 191–207. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<span class="cs1-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1007%2Fs10698-017-9302-7" rel="nofollow">10.1007/s10698-017-9302-7</a></span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Foundations+of+Chemistry&amp;rft.atitle=On+the+position+of+helium+and+neon+in+the+Periodic+Table+of+Elements&amp;rft.volume=20&amp;rft.issue=2018&amp;rft.pages=191-207&amp;rft.date=2017-11-01&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1007%2Fs10698-017-9302-7&amp;rft.aulast=Grochala&amp;rft.aufirst=Wojciech&amp;rft_id=%2F%2Fdoi.org%2F10.1007%252Fs10698-017-9302-7&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3APeriodic+table"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-189"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-189">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFBall2017">Ball, Philip (2017). <a class="external text" href="https://www.chemistryworld.com/opinion/the-group-3-dilemma/3007080.article" rel="nofollow">"The group 3 dilemma"</a>. <i>Chemistry World</i>. Royal Society of Chemistry. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20210410194549/https://www.chemistryworld.com/opinion/the-group-3-dilemma/3007080.article" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 10 April 2021<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">1 April</span> 2021</span>. <q>Every chemist knows the arguments about where hydrogen should sit, given that it is by no stretch of the imagination comfortable atop the alkali metals. But that debate is mild compared with the fury that has been incited in arguments over group 3.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=Chemistry+World&amp;rft.atitle=The+group+3+dilemma&amp;rft.date=2017&amp;rft.aulast=Ball&amp;rft.aufirst=Philip&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.chemistryworld.com%2Fopinion%2Fthe-group-3-dilemma%2F3007080.article&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3APeriodic+table"></span></span>

</li>
<li id="cite_note-PT172-192"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-PT172_192-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-PT172_192-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFPyykkö2011"><a href="/wiki/Pekka_Pyykk%C3%B6" title="Pekka Pyykkö">Pyykkö, P.</a> (2011). <a class="external text" href="https://semanticscholar.org/paper/a0ec522315904230d171353561d53f24d17dcfad" rel="nofollow">"A suggested periodic table up to Z ≤ 172, based on Dirac–Fock calculations on atoms and ions"</a>. <i>Physical Chemistry Chemical Physics</i>. <b>13</b> (1): 161–68. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Bibcode_(identifier)" title="Bibcode (identifier)">Bibcode</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://ui.adsabs.harvard.edu/abs/2011PCCP...13..161P" rel="nofollow">2011PCCP...13..161P</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1039%2Fc0cp01575j" rel="nofollow">10.1039/c0cp01575j</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/PMID_(identifier)" title="PMID (identifier)">PMID</a> <a class="external text" href="//pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/20967377" rel="nofollow">20967377</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/S2CID_(identifier)" title="S2CID (identifier)">S2CID</a> <a class="external text" href="https://api.semanticscholar.org/CorpusID:31590563" rel="nofollow">31590563</a>. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20211019202250/https://www.semanticscholar.org/paper/A-suggested-periodic-table-up-to-Z%E2%89%A4-172%2C-based-on-Pyykk%C3%B6/a0ec522315904230d171353561d53f24d17dcfad" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 19 October 2021<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-201"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-201">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFSchiffSnyderWeinberg1940">Schiff, L. I.; Snyder, H.; Weinberg, J. (1940). <li id="cite_note-211"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-211">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFPeter_Möller2016">Peter Möller (2016). <a class="external text" href="https://www.epj-conferences.org/articles/epjconf/abs/2016/26/epjconf-NS160-03002/epjconf-NS160-03002.html" rel="nofollow">"The limits of the nuclear chart set by fission and alpha decay | EPJ Web of Conferences"</a>. <i>European Physical Journal Web of Conferences</i>. <li id="cite_note-udQM-212"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-udQM_212-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFHoldomRenZhang2018">Holdom, B.; Ren, J.; Zhang, C. (2018). "Quark matter may not be strange". <i>Physical Review Letters</i>. <b>120</b> (1): 222001-1–222001-6. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ArXiv_(identifier)" title="ArXiv (identifier)">arXiv</a>:<span class="cs1-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a class="external text" href="//arxiv.org/abs/1707.06610" rel="nofollow">1707.06610</a></span>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Bibcode_(identifier)" title="Bibcode (identifier)">Bibcode</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://ui.adsabs.harvard.edu/abs/2018PhRvL.120v2001H" rel="nofollow">2018PhRvL.120v2001H</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1103%2FPhysRevLett.120.222001" rel="nofollow">10.1103/PhysRevLett.120.222001</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/PMID_(identifier)" title="PMID (identifier)">PMID</a> <a class="external text" href="//pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/29906186" rel="nofollow">29906186</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/S2CID_(identifier)" title="S2CID (identifier)">S2CID</a> <a class="external text" href="https://api.semanticscholar.org/CorpusID:49216916" rel="nofollow">49216916</a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Physical+Review+Letters&amp;rft.atitle=Quark+matter+may+not+be+strange&amp;rft.volume=120&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.pages=222001-1-222001-6&amp;rft.date=2018&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fapi.semanticscholar.org%2FCorpusID%3A49216916%23id-name%3DS2CID&amp;rft_id=info%3Abibcode%2F2018PhRvL.120v2001H&amp;rft_id=info%3Aarxiv%2F1707.06610&amp;rft_id=info%3Apmid%2F29906186&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1103%2FPhysRevLett.120.222001&amp;rft.aulast=Holdom&amp;rft.aufirst=B.&amp;rft.au=Ren%2C+J.&amp;rft.au=Zhang%2C+C.&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3APeriodic+table"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-udQMnew-213"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-udQMnew_213-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFCheng-JunShe-ShengRen-XinShan-Gui2020">Cheng-Jun, Xia; She-Sheng, Xue; Ren-Xin, Xu; Shan-Gui, Zhou (2020). </li>
<li id="cite_note-colloq-214"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-colloq_214-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFGiulianiMathesonNazarewiczOlsen2019">Giuliani, S. <li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFPetrucciHarwoodHerring2002">Petrucci, Ralph H.; Harwood, William S.; Herring, F. Geoffrey (2002). <span class="cs1-lock-registration" title="Free registration required"><a class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/generalchemistry00hill" rel="nofollow"><i>General chemistry: principles and modern applications</i></a></span> (8th ed.). Upper Saddle River, N.J: Prentice Hall. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-13-014329-7" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-13-014329-7"><bdi>978-0-13-014329-7</bdi></a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/LCCN_(identifier)" title="LCCN (identifier)">LCCN</a> <a class="external text" href="//lccn.loc.gov/2001032331" rel="nofollow">2001032331</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/OCLC_(identifier)" title="OCLC (identifier)">OCLC</a> <a class="external text" href="//www.worldcat.org/oclc/46872308" rel="nofollow">46872308</a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=General+chemistry%3A+principles+and+modern+applications&amp;rft.place=Upper+Saddle+River%2C+N.J&amp;rft.edition=8th&amp;rft.pub=Prentice+Hall&amp;rft.date=2002&amp;rft_id=info%3Aoclcnum%2F46872308&amp;rft_id=info%3Alccn%2F2001032331&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-13-014329-7&amp;rft.aulast=Petrucci&amp;rft.aufirst=Ralph+H.&amp;rft.au=Harwood%2C+William+S.&amp;rft.au=Herring%2C+F.+Geoffrey&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Farchive.org%2Fdetails%2Fgeneralchemistry00hill&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3APeriodic+table"></span></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Eric_Scerri" title="Eric Scerri">Eric Scerri</a>. 2020, <i>The Periodic Table, Its Story and Its Significance</i>, 2nd edition, Oxford University Press, New York, <link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0190914363" title="Special:BookSources/978-0190914363">978-0190914363</a>.</li></ul>
</div>

<ul><li><a class="external text" href="https://digital.sciencehistory.org/focus/periodic-tables" rel="nofollow">Periodic Table</a> featured topic page on <a href="/wiki/Science_History_Institute" title="Science History Institute">Science History Institute</a> <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20190202042542/https://digital.sciencehistory.org/" rel="nofollow">Digital Collections</a> featuring select visual representations of the periodic table of the elements, with an emphasis on alternative layouts including circular, cylindrical, pyramidal, spiral, and triangular forms.</li>

<li><a href="/wiki/Electronegativities_of_the_elements_(data_page)" title="Electronegativities of the elements (data page)">Electronegativity</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Hardnesses_of_the_elements_(data_page)" title="Hardnesses of the elements (data page)">Hardness</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Heat_capacities_of_the_elements_(data_page)" title="Heat capacities of the elements (data page)">Heat capacity</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Heats_of_fusion_of_the_elements_(data_page)" title="Heats of fusion of the elements (data page)">Heat of fusion</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Heats_of_vaporization_of_the_elements_(data_page)" title="Heats of vaporization of the elements (data page)">Heat of vaporization</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Ionization_energies_of_the_elements_(data_page)" title="Ionization energies of the elements (data page)">Ionization energy</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Melting_points_of_the_elements_(data_page)" title="Melting points of the elements (data page)">Melting point</a></li>
<li><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/List_of_oxidation_states_of_the_elements" title="List of oxidation states of the elements">Oxidation state</a></li>
<li><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Speeds_of_sound_of_the_elements_(data_page)" title="Speeds of sound of the elements (data page)">Speed of sound</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Thermal_conductivities_of_the_elements_(data_page)" title="Thermal conductivities of the elements (data page)">Thermal conductivity</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Thermal_expansion_coefficients_of_the_elements_(data_page)" title="Thermal expansion coefficients of the elements (data page)">Thermal expansion coefficient</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Vapor_pressures_of_the_elements_(data_page)" title="Vapor pressures of the elements (data page)">Vapor pressure</a></li></ul>

</div></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
